metadata.title: RHSA-2017:0300: python-oslo-middleware security update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
The OpenStack Oslo Middleware library provides components that can be injected into WSGI pipelines to intercept request and response flows. The base class can be enhanced with functionality like adding or updating HTTP headers, or to offer support for limiting size or connections.

Security Fix(es):

* An information-disclosure flaw was found in oslo.middleware. Software using the CatchError class could include sensitive values in a traceback's error message. Remote users could exploit this flaw to obtain sensitive information from OpenStack component error logs (for example, keystone tokens). (CVE-2017-2592)

Red Hat would like to thank the OpenStack project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Divya K Konoor (IBM) as the original reporter.

bugzilla.text: python-oslo-middleware: CatchErrors leaks sensitive values into error logs

criterions.comment: python-oslo-middleware is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
python-oslo-middleware-lang is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
python-oslo-middleware-tests is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
